history.content:
Hello,

Are all seminar-type classes prohibited from being tech electives, or only some?
With Phase II starting tomorrow, I am planning on taking Industrial Engineering 185, which is a seminar format class, and noticed that it is allowed under the Approved Non-Computer Science Technical Electives list (here) "All technical upper division undergraduate and graduate courses in IND ENG, except IND ENG 171, 186, 191", but on the cs major's page (here) it says, "Denotes that all courses for the major must be technical in nature. 199, 198, 197, 195, select 194, and various seminars do not count."
The course number is 185, but the class type is seminar, so I'm unsure if I'll get technical elective credits for this class. I have the same question for the IND ENG 190X series. 
Thanks,
-Time concerned LSCS student.
EDIT: The 185 I'm considering is section 2, taught by Singer (course number 27357). I'm not sure which section is which, but I believe this is the mobile app challenge lab, not the social one. Edit 2: Section 2 is indeed the mobile technology challenge lab, as seen in the schedule of classes description.
TLDR I also saw a similar question was answered 1 year ago in @536. Is it still true the mobile app challenge lab counts as a tech?
history.subject: Technical Electives - Which Seminars Count?
